name: Strategy Game: The Name Here
description:
Welcome to the super duper early access build of my untitled strategy game. If you like games like Advance Wars and Wargroove maybe you'll like where this is going?

Currently only asynchronous multiplayer works. Singleplayer is on the list.

How do I play?

First up, create an army with the army editor. The standard points value is 200 so maybe keep it at that?

Next, register an account. (Bear in mind that between this release and a hypothetical final release I will definitely nuke the database and start over at least once so don't get attached to it.)

Once you've got an account, jump on multiplayer, create a game and share that code with a friend. (You have a friend right?) 

Both of you select an army and when you're ready hit start.

What even is this map?

Art.


This is grass. You can move freely on it.


This is wall. Unless you are a ghost, you shouldn't be able to walk through it. (If you work out how to be a ghost let me know because *I* didn't add it)

This is cover. Shooting through it is more likely to miss. Units in cover have a little blue shield in the direction that they are covered from.

Who did all that beautiful art?

All units are the work of the talented Matt Walkden
The little effects animations are the work of the talented nyk_nck
